one_reviews_text:
I played this on my older computer but now that I got a 12700KF CPU and RTX 3080 with Windows 11, it just crashes on load now.

Update: I found the solution on Reddit.  It has something to do with OpenSSL and newer generation CPUs.
Follow these steps:

Go to System --> Advanced System Settings --> Environment Variables (You might get to this differently in different versions of Windows)

In THE SECOND window ("System Variables") click NEW

Enter name "OPENSSL_ia32cap"

Enter value "0x200000200000000"

Then click OK

You must REBOOT SYSTEM

This solved the crashing problem I was having with several Oculus VR apps and several Steam VR apps.

But pretty good. Using the Rift but works fine.  In the ISS, positioning your body is a pain (use both hands!) but again works fine.  Space-walking is the best bit.  Interactive bits are basic .  Did I pay for this?  No - so adding another star!  Great!
most realistic iss game might need a bit more stuff you can hold and add tools you can use on your spacewalk overall though an amazing game
simply amazing. I'm new to VR but so far this and the BBC WW2 blitz are the best free experiences

So much work has gone in to this free software and it does how, float about and find out about so many components on the ISS, experience a space walk which is pretty free roaming or work the Canada arm, lots to do and see and you can spend hours in this one app if its your interest, everything has been thaught about from inteface to controlls and all work so well. thanks for this devs! Ill also add thats it probably the best ISS and most official version your going to find, the BBC version however went from detailed to awful arcade game pretty quick!
The controls for movement kill any enjoyment. The implementation for holding bars and moving have been done properly in other games, here it causes severe motion sickness.
Please fix

I installed this with great anticipation, however, when it starts up on my Rift S, it shows the Mission: ISS logo.  When that fades out the screen is just completely black. I hear the audio of the game / music and I hear a voice telling me to choose from the menu items, but there is no video, just a black screen.  Oculus support was not able to resolve the issue.  For now, I will uninstall it, perhaps if there is an update forthcoming, I will try it again.

A detailed model of the International space station with Fantastic ambient sounds and textures, there are videos and photos to inform you on parts of the space station. It's so much fun doing the missions or just floating around with the zero gravity simulation!
If you want to freely move around the iss' U.S modules in zero g or do a spacewalk of the iss in zero g than this is a great game for you!

Thank you! Would be even cooler if developers would simulate time passing (like rotation of the Earth, moon phases, seasons, aurora borealis etc.); currently both the station and Earth are stuck in the same position. It's still awesome though! I *love* the feature which allows you to freely reorient yourself with both hands.

An extremely impressive experience - and probably the closest I'll ever be to visiting the ISS. The app runs perfectly using super sampling 2.0 on my oc'ed GTX 1080 and i7 7700K. Textures are quite good, but not as good as Lone Echo - then again nothing is. Performing a spacewalk is breathtakingly beautiful - and the polygon-count outside the station may even be higher than Lone Echo ;-) For Rift owners this app is a must - note, you'll have to move just a few meters beyond the the two spacesuits to be allowed to exit the station and do a spacewalk (bring up your tablet computer and select existing the ISS, when you're standing in the right place - took me a few minutes to find out, sigh :-)
It was cool to see the ISS and to do a spacewalk.  Don't listen to those few whiny reviews devs.  Thanks for giving us something cool, educational and free for VR.  =)

review_title: They arent going to simulate the world!!
one_reviews_text:
Of course the arent going to simulate the entire world, to do that they would need to needlessly sacrifice quality on the interior of the ISS. 

Now thats aside i have to say i was thrilled by this gem. im one of them people that even the tinest scientific inaccuarcy ruins movies, the only flaw i can see really is if you twist (two handed) off an object you were gripping onto you do not continue to rotate. other than that i had great fun flying about the interior of the ISS and the closest you will come to being in the thing.

having played it for 2 hours and seeing my young daughter play it (and do the spacewalk no problem too) i would have happily paid for this.

It would be amazing to have even more functionality, semi working computers, real missions and maybe AI or even real online crew mates .... would defo pay for that!! ;-)

This is what vr was made for, stunningly applied!

I was thrilled at first until I found two major flaws:
1. After having opened this app. many times, I noticed that only three ISS locations are displayed. One is over northern Italy, another one is over western Cuba and the last one is somewhere in a tropical region because a gigantic tropical storm is displayed, but was unable to identify the only two visible islands. If I let it run, the ISS location remains unchanged, although it rotates on its own axis. After 30 minutes to one hour, still the same position, and I believe the ISS flies around the Earth in 90 minutes...!
2. When I was in the observation dome and I removed my VR goggles to check the map, it happened a few times that when I came back and put my goggles on again, I found myself OUTSIDE of the vessel. The first time, I was somehow scared because I was drifting away. (I know, I just had to remove the goggles and quit the app., but we have to take these games seriously, don't we?) Anyhow, I found that I could get back closer to the ISS with the "thrusters" on the Rift S manipulators, but it became scarier: I could see the "framework" and the inside of the station with its bulkheads, wiring and ducts, but without its skin. The problem was that I could not get in through the open space between the frame components. I was caught between a dark space surrounding the ISS and its missing shell, and unable to get inside. I tell you, it was just like in a nightmare. (Yeah, I know, remove your goggles, dummy!) Anyhow, I fiddled with the manipulators and was able to get back inside by using the "Reset Position" feature. Still, I don't understand how come the software doesn't "lock me" inside the vessel when I am not in "Space Walk" mode.

Big fan of space, love the ISS, was looking forward to this. It starts with a nice rendering of the ISS and I was thinking okay this could be cool. I skipped trying the tutorial and went straight for the spacewalk mission, I couldn't seem to find what it was asking me to do to the spacesuit so I moved around the station which was nice. I got to the observation porthole and viewed Earth, motionless, no sense of the ISS moving or the Earth rotating. 
It would be quite a big ask to have the entire Earth reasonably accurately looming ever-present in the background, but as it was stuck at a fixed point I lost all immersion and quit. 
Pity.

This is a great learning experience for the International Space Station. There are several videos, photos and a couple things to interact with. All while moving around in zero gravity. However, you really need a good VR stomach to handle the movement in this experience. Some of the scale feels a little off, but it is a decent representation from the videos they show. It has achievements and the most difficult is to get 5 resupply modules docked without an accident. I didn’t see a way to just do the mission without having to go through the tutorial each time though. The “Look ma, two hands” achievement wouldn’t register till I changed the two hand control on and off. If you have any interest in modern astronauts, this is a must try experience.
Amazing.

review_title: Stuck in update. wont play or uninstall
one_reviews_text: The programs has been stuck in a update for 6 month. Shows an error code when you try to resume and does not allow me to un-install.

This was one of my first experiences on the Oculus Go and now I have it for the Rift S. 
Being an enthusiast for astronomy and space exploration, I loved how it lets you see how it's like in the ISS and when you get that spacesuit on, it feels amazing!

review_title: Worked, then not! Can find NO support
one_reviews_text: I enjoyed this at first but almost a year ago I entered and found I could no longer move via the blue bars. I have NEVER found any support at all. I have uninstalled, reinstalled, purchased new video card, and more...still does not work. I get messages congratulating me on completing training when I am stuck against the wall and have never got to where I am supposed to be going...
A nice small area to explore or to show it to someone. Definitely better than the free BBC space walk. Educational, but I wouldn't say it's "fun".

It's  close to a 5 stars experience, but i must admit that some movements are a bit strange. I know that is not comfortable at all, but even /as a experienced VR player), i felt a bit dizzy sometimes. Otherwise is a perfect example of what is VR right now. And what will be in the near future. thanks for this!

not real at all when your outside doing a spacewalk the earth just stays still  . we need to orbit around the earth and witness sunset and sunrise  and see the different countries .. please sort it and it will be 5 stars
review_feedback: We understand your concern. We hope you take the time to experience some of our other applications like Coco VR and Bladerunner 2049 Memory Lab.

one_reviews_text:
An excellent showcase for VR and a great immersive tool for education.

This will either help you get you VR legs or make you nauseous...You'll still enjoy the experience.

I'm a big fan of the ISS and have been listening to Scott Kelly's book for the second time.  I gave this game a try and honestly it exceeded my expectations in every way.  The US/Euro segment is able to be navigated, but the Russian segment is closed.  You can do spacewalks and you can use the Canadarm to dock a supply capsule which is just an incredible experience. The only criticisms are the "radio" transmissions from Huston which are kind of silly and break immersion a little.  Also, your body is a bit mass-less, which makes moving around easier, but when rotating with both hands can cause some discomfort.  Overall, it's totally cool.  Very highly recommended.  Played on Valve Index with Revive with no problems.  BTW, the earth is moving in the background.  Some people said it wasn't but it is.  There's no day/night cycle, but hopefully that will be added in the future for a truly terrifying experience.  Then they will need to add headlamps to the spacesuits.  I can't believe this is free.  I'd pay money for this.

This is pretty much the best reality-based space VR experience I've tried. The feeling is genuinely like being in microgravity. I've used this in a public installation and it was the most popular VR app in our catalogue, until we changed from using Rift to Oculus Go, which doesn't work nearly as well. Please tell me you're planning to make it available on Oculus Quest because I'd do anything to be able to start using it again!
review_feedback: So happy to hear you're digging it.  It's available on Quest! :)

one_reviews_text:
I always wanted to go to space, but health problems are not allowing me to do so. Thanks to this I am as close to my dream as possilble. You can see all the things with descriptions made by real astronauts - and the BEST part: you can TRY a lot of stuff yourself. I have learned a lot.

Yes, mechanics of this game are challenging, but it actually adds to feeling like you are in ISS. I lost track of floor direction almost immediately :-D

I have to admint - as I stood in tank top and sweat pants and operated Canadarm - I totally felt like Ripley. Which brings me to interresting idea. Can you imagine upgrade to this game, where you actually are fighting something? Like alien, but with current tech? On ISS?

Anyway this is absolutely best space simulator I have ever seen.
This is amazing!

Great experience for both adults and kids. Learn about how astronauts float around the ISS and do their daily duties. Looking forward to that SpaceX - Crew Dragon update. ;)

I would gladly pay for more content.
review_feedback: Glad to hear it!  We'll probably keep it all free though. :)  Inspiring people is reward enough.

review_title: The best things in life are free...
one_reviews_text:
Mission ISS gives great weight to the old adage "the best things in life are free."   This is a spectacular app!

It provides a full and detailed recreation of the ISS' interior, and the views of space and earth through exterior facing windows are truly breathtaking.

Add to that the ability to control the Canadarm to help a supply capsule dock, and a spacewalk, and by the end of this, you'll feel you've been there, and done it.

The only criticism, the experience is all to brief - as is too often the case with VR exclusive titles.  Still, this is a must-have for anyone and everyone, particularly if you're a stargazer.

An incredible game could be made out of this layout.  Life on the ISS.  A few weeks of missions, experiments, Canadarm tasks, spacewalks and repairs ... it's screaming for an update.  Ah well, it costs nothing to dream. :)

Highly recommended.
review_feedback: In the infinite cold of Space, reviews like this warm our hearts. :). Thanks for playing!

one_reviews_text: this was much more than I expected. was instantly captivated with exploring the ISS, actually feel like I learned some things, and am grateful for this experience. thank you, devs!
Really feels like being in the space station. The EVA is quite fun too. Too bad you cannot go further on the EVA.
review_feedback: Agreed!  It would be awesome to go further.  Unfortunately the next place you can visit is 250 miles away, and it took too long for our play testers to get there, so we cut it for budget reasons. :)

one_reviews_text: Really great experience exploring the ISS and doing things like docking the capsule really makes you feel like an astronaut! This is VR at it's best!
Wow!, so much love and detail in this free game. Its my absolute favorite to show off VR with to others. The views are amazing, the movement is amazing, the sound is spectacular.
Awesome that it includes facts and the ability to go on spacewalks but if playing for along time can cause motion sickness for even people who don't experience it.
review_feedback: Glad you like it!  It's hard to beat that disorientation.  It's why Astronauts train so long.  People just don't feel comfortable when there's no "up" until they've done it for a while.  (And I'm sure traveling almost 5 miles per second doesn't help)

one_reviews_text: If you're a space nerd, which I'm sure you probably are if you're here, then you're going to love this. The developers did an excellent job of re-creating the ISS in high definition and I love how it includes educational snippets/videos/images containing real astronauts explaining how different things work. The motion is also great (although you are likely to feel a bit of disorientation/motion sickness at times, even if you're used to it in VR like I am, but that only testifies to how real it feels). And it's free, so you've no excuse for not giving it a try. Well done people behind this, I thought this experience was excellent.
review_feedback: Thanks Ricardus!  It's been a pleasure to create, and we're so glad you enjoy it.

review_title: The most fun I've had in a free VR game
one_reviews_text: I really like this game. It is so good and it was the most fun I've had for a free game. Very well done to everyone involved!

review_title: how to play this in htcvive？
one_reviews_text: i have a VR of HTCVIVE and how should i do to play this game? please help me everyone！and i had use the revive and it is inoperative......(sorry I am not good at English)
The spacewalk was a truly breathtaking experience for me. Get it just for that!

It's a bit short but it's free so I'm not gonna make a judgement on that. Just moving around in zero-g in the International Space Station, an envornment designed to be navigated in zero-g, is awesome. It's totally worth a download. Definitely check this one out.

It just needs more "missions" and it could become a great game. I am thinking about random events and such and you need to keep things together as the only operator. Doing repairs, etc.. Lots of ideas. Solid groundwork on the movement and scaling. Perfect experience of space walk and very immersive. Can be played entirely seated
review_feedback:
Thanks Lazy Snake!
We agree, it would be nice to make some more missions.
Glad you're enjoying what's in there so far.

one_reviews_text: The controls are bad in my opinion
review_feedback:
Thanks for the feedback csangste,

We are continuously finding ways to enhance our experiences to better serve our growing community, whether it be updating our live experiences or taking this kind of feedback into account for our upcoming experiences. Please hop into any of our other experiences as you'll see progress in control scheme design. 

Thanks!

review_title: Explore the space station in VR!
one_reviews_text: One of the coolest experiences in VR. You really feel like you're on the space station, and the level of detail is incredible. The only thing I'd like is more to do, more videos and interactable objects, but for a free experience this is top notch.

This is so cool, but, i won't believe that the robot arm is controlled upp there in reality like in this game, i was getting really frustrated by how the controls makes no sense. You don't have no real way to see what is going on or grasp what does what. But the experience is way awesome.
good
One of the best experiences in VR!
Extremely cool experience and very well made, unfortunately I had to vomit every couple minutes ...
Nearly impossible starting missions, Please fix. Could not beat docking even if nothing touched.

I tried this a bit skeptical but couldn't be more wrong. It features the same locomotion as in Lone Echo, simplified of course. The ISS is very well done and overall a very informative and inmersive game. My only complain is the mini-games, perhaps too much complicated but I guess they strike for realism.

This VR game is one of the best and most beautiful I have ever played, everything is very detailed and looks nice, but I would wish to be able to enter the russian part of the space station as well, because it is as huge as the american and chinese part or bigger.

Thank you for creating this. As a kid, I dreamed of being a Shuttle astronaut. Maybe my daughter will carry that torch someday in a new craft. But in any case, this is an extremely special experience. It takes a bit of mental calming to get control of your bearings, but I soon began to feel that I was actually pushing off and gracefully flying through and around the station. I feel that I have a much more intimate understanding of the ISS.

Now I can't help but wonder about a complete mission, launch to landing... :)

review_title: Would gladly pay for more missions
one_reviews_text: and/or the russian segments

What an experience! Absolutely captivating as an immersive space demo. Educational, interactive, gorgeous.

The biggest set-back of this one here is the clunky turning. It fades out and in quickly rather than being smooth movement which ruins the immersion and the only other option is to turn yourself by grabbing objects with both hands. This is a setting you have to turn on. Unfortunately, it is so terrible in execution that it makes it a pain in the neck to turn and really hampers the entire immersion :( 

The forward and backward movement is very well executed and fluid and to have messed up the turning this bad is a shame.

Still a must have as a tech demo and as an overall experience.

It's really nice detailed in and outside. Nice missions not to easy not to hard.
Recommended

Try it if you like space. The real stuff.
Only missing is that you can't go inside the russian part of the station. You can see it from outside at least :)

2 small missions, bits of documentary, and a lot of exploration make a great app to learn and relax.
If you have a strong stomach, you can enable 2 handed rotations, and feel even better like an astronaut !

review_title: The closest an ordinary human can be to
one_reviews_text: International Space Station.  Marvellous experience and it's free, so what are you waiting for?!
Highly recommended.
That's great app
This is one of the first apps I show folks. It's amazing. When the credits first roll, and Earth appears below you... People always put their hands out and go, "Whoh!"

review_title: i cant get past the first mission
one_reviews_text: I have tryed everything it has got to the point where i think its imposible its either way way too hard or my game is broken. i cant find a solution i have tryed every angle i can posibly do to get it to the ship but i can it always hits the ship. plz fix it... other wise i cant stop playing the tutorial but thats all i can do.

not one for heights,  but one's brain trying to tell you it's real.  

great stuff

Feels like being in space; I have no clue since I have never been there; but it feels like what the real thing should be, looking at it from a scientific perspective. Lots of material and videos around to look at; I did play the intro part and got sucked in for a long time. Floating takes a bit to get used to; but once you do, you will be grabbing and floating like a pro.
As simulation is probably the best ever made for VR; it is realistic and as such, you can buy that this is how it feels to be in space. 
The negative is the space walks; graphics outside are not that great; and you are fundamentally spiderman, since you can just grab anything and move around, instead of being scared for having to use only the rails. Looking forward to more experiences like this; where you enjoy them and also learn something.
Of course you and I haven't been in zero gravity, much less in the ISS, but I'm certain this is what it would look like being inside (and out if on a space walk) the station.
You feed like an Astronaut

review_title: It is a better VR demo than Lone Echo
one_reviews_text: The mechanic is not as good as Lone Echo but similar enough and the graphics are better. You really have the feeling of being an astronaut.

It feels very realistic and looks very good too, and just when you think its actually real your reminded that the earth really isnt round and that your most definitely in a game.

Apart from that its an easy win seeing as its free.

review_title: I felt like I really went to space
one_reviews_text: This is about as close to being an astronaught as I'm ever going to get. The graphics are actually pretty good. But what really did it for me was the movement, after a while I started to actually feel weightless. I also didn't experience any motion sickness. The whole thing feels hyper realistic and it even has some limited gameplay in the form of missions. I actually would have been willing to pay $20-30, the fact that it's free makes this a MUST play in my book.
The install gets to 100% and then keeps saying not installed. I Have tried about 15 times now and still nothing. Anyone else have this problem?
My inner Neil Degrasse Tyson excited!

Honestly, I really liked the concept of the game. It's educational, fun, and I love the realistic movement. HOWEVER, I felt extremely nauseous after playing for a just a little while and couldn't return without feeling extremely sick. Then again, my medical history says I'm prone to motion sickness, so it might just be that I'm sensitive.
If you're looking to see what it's like aboard a real space station, this is for you. If you're prone to motion sickness, be sure to check it out anyways, but keep a bucket nearby (just in case).
Awesome

This is a wonderful educational experience and a must download for anybody interested in space/science. If you have the graphical horsepower to bump the supersampling up it's a really beautiful, almost photo realistic simulation which can literally take your breath away. Seeing the earth from the little cockpit known as the cupola is a clear demonstration of how virtual reality can transport you into worlds and experiences impossible elsewhere. If you rate this against other paid for VR experiences titles such as Everest, Apollo 11, Chernobyl, The Blu etc I actually rate this the best. That it is completely free means it should be on every new rift owner's immediate download list!

review_title: Just have fun, don't be a nerd
one_reviews_text: Okay, this game is supposed to be about learning about the ISS (not ISIS) and appreciation for space and science.  There's missions you can do for those nerdy NASA scientists.  But forget all that boring crap, just have fun floating in space and navigating around and outside the ISS.  Your VR headset will trick your mind into believing you're in zero gravity.  You propel yourself forward and grab unto stuff.  Just don't fall down IRL.  *Spoiler Alert*  You can't potty in the ISS toilet, but your mind will be blown when you see how it's done there *end spoiler* :O

For anyone who has ever wondered what it would be like to visit the space station, this game will give you the answer.  High quality graphics and interesting embedded videos to explain what you are looking at.  Loved it.  Thank you!
I am fighting motion sickness as to be expected with a game like this. Very fun though
sad i can only EVA once... and i want to see the whole station.

If you aren't a real astronaut, this is a must. Seeing the ISS inside, how the astronauts do their day to day lives, doing space walks, and over all, being able to see the world "under" you is an unique experience. A must.

+: Educative videos
+: You get to control Canadarm2!
+: Relatively good graphics
=: Got a defect (bug) only a few minutes in where I was propelled outside of the space station after hitting a wall.
=: Don’t be stupid and remember that you can propel yourself once in space!
-: Joystick on Touch controller to control angle of view should be avoided as it changes angle abruptly.
-: Definitively dizziness inducing mostly at unexpected times – some people could likely experience motion sickness.
-: Experienced situations where no indicator was pointing to an objective and the instructions were not repeated.
Pro tip: Definitively make sure to at least try the two hand grip mode! Nothing beats inverting your hands to grab an object and bringing them back in the right position to perform a 180 degree.
Misc. comment: While it would be a fantastic experience, living in the space station would get tedious quickly for a lot of us! Thanks to our astronauts for doing this relatively risky job on behalf of all of us - Do the Canadarm2 mission and you will understand the stress there people can withstand!
i cant find the game in oculus > software > software and oculus > downloads
Doesn't work without oculus touch.
How is this free i have never seen a game so life changing.
Missions are bad.

Was having a good time until I got the first mission, to do some sort of cargo docking mission using a robotic arm. It fails every time I touch anything with the robotic arm, even when I line up exactly with the docking port that the glowing arrows are pointing at... What the heck am I supposed to be doing there? VR and this game is apparently so obscure that I can't even google a solution. 

Better locomotion system would have helped a lot too. It's okay when I'm grabbing and moving along the side of the station, but 'free flight' with thrusters inside the station is disorienting and uncomfortable.
Fantastic experience, entertaining and educative, intuitive controls and very polished. This one ticks ALL the boxes, I wish more VR games/demo`s were like this.

A truley beautiful experiance, if you can get over the motion sickness feeling this can give you. I loved every minute of this right up untill the point when I had to go and sit outside. Definatly worth it for all space enthusiasts!

review_title: One of the Best VR experinces
one_reviews_text: Caution it will most likely cause motion sickness. To reduce it sit down. Standing will make the experince ten times better but motion sickness will happen. The game itself it is fun and interactive. Makes you feel like a real space explorer and feel the zero gravity. It is also informational as you will learn many things and how to use and live in space station. A must try for anyone.

review_title: Five Star Even With Motion Sickness
one_reviews_text: I come from a deep sea fishing family. Have spent thousands of hours at sea. Motion doesn't get to me. VR games don't give me any kind of motion sickness. But this one crushed me. That doesn't mean it deserves a one star review. It is a five star experience. Absolutely beautiful. Space walking over an earthside hurricane is the coolest! Outside the ISS is much easier on the motion sickness - none really. But inside the ISS, I just couldn't hack it for more than ten minutes tops. Tried three separate times many days apart. Each time, five to ten minutes and I was motion sick and out of sorts for an hour. Like AWFUL! Motion sickness can often be psychological as well as physical. This experience has my number, but I recommend it to everyone. If you can float around without an issue then you will love it! I am jealous of those that can take it all in. Really well done!
The program is great, really makes me feel weightless, and the difficulty that comes with that. Too few missions, i'd like more eva missions, and day to day missions.

review_title: Amazing but could cause motion sickness
one_reviews_text: I think its awesome to float around the space station!  it is a little wierd to stand and use the app though.  It is far suprior to several other apps I've tried though.  I did find it a little disorienting.  This is free and a no brainer to try in my opinion.

The detail of the ISS interior and the Earth detail is superb.  The zero gravity floating does make me a little giddy, but then real zero gravity probably would!  It reminds of the film 'Gravity' with Sandra Bullock chasing through the ISS compartments!  Maybe we could have a docked shuttle?
I had a blast visiting the ISS! An amazing experience. Im pretty crappy at running the capture arm, but it was still fun.

I have a better understanding of the ISS after playing this FREE experience. It is well put together and is the closest a normal person could get to being on the ISS. I felt like a tourist. There are better space games out there like Elite Dangerous or Lone Echo, but those are rooted in fantasy- the ISS actually exists. If you have any interest in the ISS, this is good stuff and you won't be wasting your time.

It looks amazing, the graphics and details are superb. Moving/floating forward is fluid right up until you have to turn.....For some stupid reason its a jerky, cut scene...Why cant you move around freely? Ruins the whole thing for me.
I truley felt like i was in space and the mechanics to move in thisgame are superb once you get out of the iss the motion sickness isn't that bad but other than that would recomend!
wish the missions were a bit easier to go through upon return.  Seems like everything reset on me when i quit.

Very polished experience that really gives you the sensation of being in space. Aside from exploring the ISS, either by pushing forward on the thumbstick or by grabbing and pushing off, there are several missions and many videos to watch. The videos are very educational. Given in the context of where you are on the ISS, the videos become that much more relatable and engaging. The missions are incredibly fun and well designed. Using the robot arm to grab the cargo load is amazing, especially how you can use the camera view or by looking outside as well. There is also a mission where you get to go on a spacewalk and inspect a panel which is incredibly fun. This experience is a must-play for everyone who is not too prone to getting motion sickness.
keeps trying install cannot install stop straight away says contact occulus support
This is awesome! Freemode option available but I wish there was more to do.

Definitely one of the best free experience with excellent "in space moving system" on Oculus Store , everyone should try this!
ps. I wish only "2 HANDED ROTATION" was "ON" from the beginning - not hide inside options...

review_title: VR at its best for free
one_reviews_text: This is what i want to experience in VR. Great Job
like it very much, great vr.
Very well done. Feels like your in zero gravity. Can take a little time to get used to it, if you get motion sickness? Great to look down at Earth and float or pull yourself around the ISS.

review_title: A rare gem in a sea of mediocrity
one_reviews_text:
As the son of a 35 year NASA astronaut trainer, I was skeptical that this would be a worthwhile title. As a teenager I had the opportunity to experience the space shuttle simulators at JSC in Houston on multiple occasions. 

While not as detailed as the real thing, this ISS experience definately reminded me of the simulators I saw at NASA 30 years ago.

Good stuff -- highly recommeded.

Great simulation, feels like you're there. 
Now we wait for the other modules, or the ability to open/close hatches, etc !

review_title: Nice being able to explore the ISS but..
one_reviews_text: Don't try to explore the station in the training mode... the voiceover keeps talking over the videos I when you're trying to watch them.

Here it is in a nut shell. Float along corridors, manipulate a robot arm whilst a repeating recorded voice says things like "woah don't get to close". Once you get over the oh wow, computer graphics stage there is little here to make this a worthwhile experience for anyone beyond a new VR user.
incredible experience !

If you have even the slightest bit of interest in the ISS, then I think for the price this is a good deal.  The movement is very natural and very fun (I recommend turning on 2-handed navigation from the menu, it's not the default setting so you have to proactively turn it on).  I am prone to occasional motion sickness in VR but it's not a problem for me on this one; I believe because my brain is simply becoming more accustomed to VR in general. So my guess is, if you're still new to VR then perhaps you'll experience some motion sickness, but over time that will dissipate.  And heck, it's not like astronauts never get motion sickness in real life while in zero gravity so just chalk it up to realism if it happens, lol. My only regret is there isn't more to see and do.  The Russian part of the ISS is inaccessible, I don't know how realistic that is. If it's used for storage in RL then I can see why they wouldn't bother to model it in the game, but an explanation for why you can't visit a third of the station would be nice. My other gripe is there are only two missions.  One is capturing a supply capsule and connecting it to the ISS using the Canada Arm, the other is exiting the airlock in a spacesuit for a quick EVA. Both are great fun, and I would like more.  Using the Canada Arm is especially rewarding because of the Touch controllers: you grab the translational joysticks just as you would in RL, so you're moving your hands in precisely the same motions that an astronaut would have to in order to capture a supply capsule and dock it to the station(!) The missions wouldn't have to be completely different than the existing two, just more variations of those same two.  But if my only gripe is that there isn't more of this game, and the game is only $11 and change, then it's a pretty solid purchase.
Please allow xbox controller or mouse/keyboard. Should be possible, technically... No ISS for me without alternative controls =( Can't even select a mission.

Very nice graphic wise. But the idea of 90-degrees turn is extremely annoying to me. And you have to use it because even though you can look in any direction you can NOT use both touch controllers at the same time to rotate... while you can grab things and pull/push your way around the statition you cannot rotate your body except for 90 degree turns! This is a very big negative and takes alot away from an otherwise nice app. I would give 4-5 stars if this issue alone was fixed. Secondly the external view is fixed (the station don't seem to be moving) which is also weird.

review_title: A Must Try with Huge Potential
one_reviews_text:
First of all let me just say that this is an amazing experiance in the Rift, Considering it is free its absolutly incredible! I had a lot of fun floating around inside, docking ships from the cupola and doing EVAs. I do however have a few improvements.

1: Proper 3D earth. One of my biggest gripes with this is that is does not show the ISS zooming around the planet at 17200 mph but instead shows it in a geostationary orbit above some place. The earth out the window is nothing more than a stationary image. :( this is a shame as I was looking forward to watching the world go by below me but its far too static I'm afraid. This is expecially important if this wants to be used in an education situation where youre trying to teach kids about the ISS and how it orbits the earth. It would not be difficult to make a 3D earth and have it rotating below the ISS in a realistic manner... From that altitude it doesn't need to be more than a sphere with some satalite photos on it and a spec/gloss map for water.

2:Proper Day/Night cycle. This fits in with the previous point... once you give it an earth to orbit around you then need to think about a proper day/night cycle. The ISS orbits the earth in about 90 mins so it experiances day/sunset/night/sunrise in that time... thats 16 times a day! It would be awesome for it to have a realistic day/night cycle. Surely one of the greatest things you get to see as an astronaut is a sunrise or sunset during an EVA and all of the city night lights scudding by below you. I understand there may some technical limitations to this with shadows/etc but ADRIFT managed to do it fairly well.

I'd happily pay £10-15 for a version of this with those two above features added. I think it would add much more to the experiance, and also make it more realistic for education etc.

3: Is more things to do, ship repairs, taking photos from the cupola of specific cities on the awesome 3D earth etc ;)

Anyway, Its great. Give it a go if you havn't!
Would be cool to have more interactive things aboard, but for the price tag, this is a must play!

Hey MickDK, if you hit the Settings menu in the Tablet, you can enable two handed rotation.  It's not recommended for sensitive first-time astronauts, but lets pro users get around quickly and skips the funky joystick turns.

There is no free rotation and while you grab a bar you can not rotate your body with your hand like you would as an astronaut. There are no options to disable the comfort mode. :( Adrift definitely showed better controls and I had a way better feeling of flying in zero g.
review_feedback: In the Settings menu (the gear icon on your tablet), where it says '2 handed rotation'.  Turn that to ON

one_reviews_text: I can't stand jerky angled turning in VR. Why do developers enforce this instead of giving the option for smooth turning? I don't care if some people get sick - I don't. It completely ruins the immersion and the feeling of free floating. I was so disappointed because it looks really high quality.

I was planning to make this myself, just so it existed. Now I don't have to! I hope someday they add more detail, like the Russian section of the station, which is sadly missing, the ability to open the food crates, watch some water balls in space, and open the bed areas to look and get inside. And people. It would be great to meet people going about their days, doing experiments. I'd gladly pay $60 for this if they added 10 more missions like the three here. Add the ability to experience the whole deal like crew switch-out; you fly up, you dock, you live, you experiment, you switch out and go home and experience re-entry. It'd be great.
-
For totally political reasons, add a section that explains the huge benefits of the space program up to now and into the future, and compare that to how small the actual budget is.
-
Con: re-orienting yourself once you've turned vertically is tricky since vertical rotation messes with the angle increments, so you get into weird diagonal angles you can't easily get out of. You have to rotate down, tilt your head sideways, then rotate back up. Not bad, but it would be great to have an option to re-align yourself to an arbitary wall direction.
-
It's free, and I enjoyed it more than many paid experiences because of the sense of immersion it gives, ESPECIALLY the sound design, with all the white noise of varying pitches, and the whirring around your head when you get close to some machinery and windows. Excellent job on that.

As a taste of moving around an orbiting space station in microgravity using your Touch hands, this gets me excited for Lone Echo.  
-
We need more VR experiences that focus on existence, on "day in the life" stuff. Realize that the mundane aspects of another person's life, can feel extraordinary and enriching to experience. We don't NEED an amazing twisting, thrilling plot as much as we need EXISTENCE, PROGRESSION, and FREEDOM to exist and explore and live as another lives. This gives a taste of that.

Grabbing walls and other fixed stuff to move around is the best way to move in VR that I have encountered until now. Although it may seem only applicable to zero-gravity environments, this way to move in the VR environment by grabbing things to advance in a certain direction could be applied to any env - where the user may be allowed to grab anytime anywhere ("grab air") with the left hand. It is the most realistic and engaging experience of movement in VR, better than teleporting from fixed point-to fixed point and much better than moving around using the joysticks. Also this is much less nauseating. As an example for future developments, in a shooter people could use their left hand to grab (air) and push themselves in a certain direction based on the direction of the hand movement. Non-zero-gravity environments would allow only movement on a plane, not in 3-dimensions like in this astronaut simulator.

This is beautiful and is probably a great experience if you stick with it but unfortunately this is the first VR game that has given me full on motion sickness. I will maybe try again another time but for now it's not for me. I managed about 15 minutes before I felt truly sick. Probably a realistic simulation of being in space in that respect. ;)

If you ever wanted to be an astronaut, this is a must have. This app is very well done. Every detail of the International Space Station seems to be acurately modeled and the videos from actual astronauts is worthy bonus. It makes great use of the Touch as well, moving through the station by grabbing walls is effortless and the sensation of hanging on to the exterior as you EVA over Florida is breathtaking. However, I never experienced nausea in the hour plus I spent floating around as many others have complained about.
No russian modules? Even a little allusion? Is it <Internetaional> Space Station?

Very detailed and accurate! If you watched the movie "Life" in Theathers recently you will be a bit extra scared when floating around ISS :) This is though the first time I got motion sick in VR after a while. A must check out though! :)
This is one of the best VR experiences I've had so far! Fully immersive, educational and a lot of Fun. Only thing is I had to stop playing because I got nauseous. ;)

Another must-have VR game from Oculus. It can be a bit nausiating standing above thin air, however you soon get used to it and it becomes an amazingly immersive and intresting experience. It's also nice to get a preview of the no-gravity movement experience, which will be used in the highly anticipated game Lone Echo. Be aware that this isn't a game or something you'll find yourself coming back to again and again - it's an experience (a very good one) which you'll play for around 10 minutes.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mNAAHHnb1TQ
To experience the life of an astronaut on the International Space Station is an opportunity anyone in their right mind should not miss. VR gives you that opportunity and it is an Amazing experience!

review_title: Motion sickness and boring after a bit
one_reviews_text:
I got easy some motion sickness on this game. Also there isn't really much to do and from Oculus Studio i would have expected much more interactions with objects.. like be able to open drawers or pick bottles and squeeze them.. Instead i could barely grab items and explore around.

Still it's quite impressive the overall graphics and was nice at first to move grabbing the bars and pushing me forward.. before you got too nausea it's cool.

3 stars also because it's free. Would have get 2 if it was paid.
Keep crashing...

review_title: Good Experience for a free game!
one_reviews_text:
i love space and with this game, it was a fun Experience to be able to menouver around the ISS. NNot only is this game Free, Yes FREE to download and play. it Includes free roam around the station, free roam Outside the station and do missions. 

Personally i only free roamed inside because im not ready for flying around outside yet (afraid of heights) so it's getting used to it :) 

Perfect for those Trying out VR for the first time! 

im not quite ready to move around outside of the station yet (afraid of heights) but it's a fun game for those looking for some VR experience!
So, traveling around the corridors is cool and all but the best part is using the ISS robotic arm to catch and berth the Dragon spacecraft.  #SpaceX

review_title: Beautiful sim, tons to learn about
one_reviews_text: First I was astonished at how awesome everything looked, but then I noticed I could click on stuff (like equipment and mission patches) and couldn't stop watching the videos. I loved that they put the videos in the same spot in the station as they were actually taken on the real ISS.  I found 2-handed navigation to be incredibly useful and intuitive and wish they would turn it on by default (It's in the settings menu on the tablet if you haven't found it yet).  Seriously would pay $20 or more for this.  It's gorgeous!

A great experience! The graphics and 3D audio really added to the presence I felt when playing ISS. It was very comfortable to play, no issues with nausea.  Thank you to all who made this experience possible. I found it very interesting and enjoyable. I think after two hours of hard work, this astronaut deserves a good meal. :)
Did I just do docking using the same controls like a real astronaut? Just amazing. I apprentice that they finally experiment with more advanced movement styles, UIs and controls in their games/demos.

Pros:
Real live space station!  This is what VR experiences are all about.  Taking you places (real or imagined) and letting you do things you'd never be able to do otherwise.  Inside the space station is mostly 3D and moderately interactive.  Great for free, would pay $10-20 for a full up production (like ADR1FT but real!)

Cons:
Should remove the "jets" and stick with the awesome push/grab system.  It's a freebie and it shows in various small ways.  Like the jet section, very limited "missions", mission audio playing over the in app videos, limited quality beyond the ISS itself, etc.

I have not used the occulus rift a lot, so far but I have tried many applications. This was probably the best virtual reality I had so far : the immersion is just perfect.
Thanks for this job!
Enjoy this short experience, where you get to float around a virtual section of the ISS space station. The joke is on us though, because the actual space station is also virtual ...

This is the first good quality educational-ish experience on VR. There are other apps that are educational (Unimersiv) but they are very low quality in terms of production, presentation. Mission: ISS has good (I won't say high or triple A standards) presentation and quality and has educational value (even though they could have given it more of an educational focus than they did). This is, in my opinion, exactly what VR needs more of. My nephew had to watch some videos on the ISS for his 7th grade class... how much cooler would it have been for him to play this? PS. A lot of people are complaining about motion sickneess. I was expecting this to get me really sick, since I tend to be very susceptible to flight/float kinds of VR motion sickness. I can't really play Ultrawings or Detached for more than five minutes without getting sick.  (I don't experience motion sickness at all for walking-locomotion, since becoming accustomed to it via Arizona Sunshine.) However, I didn't have any problem with this game. Don't just assume that if you tend to be susceptible to motion sickness that this game isn't for you... Motion sickness is very subjective and effects people in different ways.
Though a little bit short I will never forget my visit to the orbit station. Thank you to all involved!
I enjoyed the robotic arm task and the overall level of graphics detail and the ambient sound. I only wish the hatch to the Russian segment were open :)

review_title: CAREFUL : AWESOME BUT HUGE MOTION SICKN
one_reviews_text: I am not gonna lie, this is an incredible experience. I played it for around 20min. But now that I have removed my headset fort almost 20min too, I still feel sick as hell. Be careful !

For free this is an awesome program! 

Motion sickness can be an issue, but as there is no hurry, you get a chance to get used to the movement. First I had problems but the next day I could explore for an hour or so without problems. 

I really got an impression of the ISS and learned a lot. But then there are some things missing and I hope the developers are not finished with this little gem. There is no access to the russian modules. There should be more interaction or at least more explaining movies. Those that are in there are good, though. 
I also liked exploring the ISS in EVA. But especially outside there are so many interesting things to see because of the great detail level and I asked myself "What is this? What is that for?..." And it would be great if you could just point to it and get an explaination.
I also spotted the AMS-experiment. I know that this is an antimatter detector for dark matter research, but got no word about it from the program. 

BUT: This is a great start and could grow even better with more information.

I played about 3 minutes before I HAD to stop in order not to feel sick for the rest of the day.
Well designed enviroment though!

This is one of my favorite VR experiences to date. However, it does have some flaws (intro sequence chopping my legs and head off) and a few missed opportunities (let me use everything, press some buttons, explore the sleeping quarters, board the Dragon, interact with the crew). With another month of development this could have been the best VR experience available, in my opinion.

This is one the best VR experiences I have had so far (including Project Cars, FSX, Elite Dangerous and Robo Recall). It is just too short, but for free what more can you ask?  I wish you could EVA tour the station, but alas, only the mission is available.  However, it is one hell of an experience and one to share with others!  Incredible.

review_title: A good experience but needs polishing
one_reviews_text:
This is very immersive and awesome but it needs some polish, like the haptics don't seem to work properly, and are erratic, you can add some animations to the airlock when EVA, and i don't see the difference between training and missions, these two modules are exactly the same !
Globally this experience is a must have though as it is very interesting .

Its interesting & the graphics look great but my hands kept getting stuck & glitching out & it became frustrating. The missions are ok but not exactly riveting. I was a bit dissapointed you can't float out to space because there is an ivisable wall. I also with there was more interaction. But for free its brilliant & quality of the experience is above what you may pay for. I really hope there is more factual content like this to come out on Oculus.

This was a fantastic experience! Using the touch controllers, you can explore the International Space Station (ISS). I would've paid real money for that experience alone with no extra features, and yet here they included pop-up-videos detailing those "what-the-heck-is-that-thing?" moments using Astronaut Suni Williams, as she floats around the actual ISS in the same location. Also included is a little zero G training, a docking mission, and a quick EVA outside.
All this for FREE? Seriously, what is there not to like?

review_title: New appreciation for what we've got
one_reviews_text: What an amazing gift this experience is.  I've occasionally watched videos of ISS astronauts talking about this and that, but it's something else to be there in that space (pun!) taking it in, and then following up on whatever curious urge that may strike.  Going outside was surreal.  Using the Canadarm was surreal.  Becoming familiar with this place I'll never visit is surreal.  This experience makes me very proud of what we as a species are accomplishing, and hope we continue down that path.   FEEDBACK:  The videos and info panels that can be triggered throughout are very informational and entertaining.  They honestly left me wanting more of them, so I'm hoping there will be future updates to that effect.   The only gripe I have is that voiceovers in the tutorial and missions modes interrupt any info panel video I have running, and it's not obvious how to dismiss an info panel except just flying away from it.  And I'd love English subtitles for voiceovers/videos.

This is an incredible experience that really makes you feel like you're an astronaut on the ISS. It is rated MODERATE, not Comfortable- so *don't* run it if you get VR sick! However one thing I think exacerbates this and should be changed is the fact that colliding with geometry "pushes" you away from it, which overrides your positional tracking. Instead, the screen should get darker as you go into geometry, so that when in it, screen is totally black (and Touch controls should turn transparent). Right now, this annoying and puzzling design decision is the only thing keeping it from 5 stars.

This experience was great, the graphics are really well done as well!  But you miss out on probably the best part of the ISS - watching the earth fly past below you, watching the sun rise and sun set.   Please make the ISS move over the earth!!!!  Also, give me the opportunity to rotate naturally not in 30deg increments. I know some people get sick, but give me the option to choose.  Please update with more missions and have an interrupt script so your missions don't interrupt the videos...I was watching that and missed some of it cause some mission wants me to move...no way to forward/rewind or pause a video.

Thank you very much for this experience! It's a dream to explore the International Space Station. Also the docking maneuver makes a lot of fun. Would be great to get a Space Shuttle with the same quality too. The additional training sessions are great. Watching the ISS from the EVA suite is amazing. That's the best and detailed VR Simulation I have ever seen :-)
I really enjoyed playing this. I felt like I was actually in the space station. [DISCLAIMER] YOU WILL GET MOTION SICK IF YOU DO NOT LEAN THE DIRECTION YOU ARE GOING!
Very beautifully done.  The movement is quite intuitive.  I wish I wasn't so prone to motion sickness though.  I won't be able to play this one very much.

I'd recommend this to anyone who is into Space at all, it was really polished and lots of information. I really like the way you can point at things and it brings up videos etc with more info. I wasn't a fan of the hands not being able to go through objects, I kept getting my hands stuck in places and it created a disconnect, I would of preferred at least a ghosting effect of where my real hands are. I also felt a little motion sick but I am really susceptible to it, the comfort movement did help, I liked being able to pull myself around.

Absolutely what I always wanted from VR, breathtaking Experience (especially the Spacewalk) with a few interactive elements and educational material to learn a few things about the astronauts everyday work.
Great Controls, Grabbing onto things and pushing yourself forward feels natural and no nausia at all! (approximately 1h without pause)
More of this Oculus!!! :)

I'll make it short:
- Beautifully, accurate modelled ISS Sections
- Very immersive movement system, almost as in reality
- Video and picture-explanations of certain modules and systems in the station 
- Ability to take an EVA to drag arround the outside of the station in free space!
- It's an absolutely free experience! 

Thank you Oculus Studios! Love it!

To quote NASA: "Have you ever wondered if you have what it takes to become a NASA Astronaut?" Who would have thought that all you need is a Rift with Touch Controller?! :-D
Thank you so much for this beautiful adventure! This is for sure an experience out of this world!

Ohhh the precence and feeling of being at the ISS. Easy to move around using touch to pull / push you around in weightless mode without getting nauseous at all.
Just remember to up your gfx. It's set to low from start.

Feels like I have really been up there now :)
One on my first touch experiences, and it is a wonder! Educational, immersive and fantastic. I would love more NASA

I just experienced how the ISS feels and saw the earth as the astronauts sees it.
The missions and interactivity is great. There are videos everywhere giving you more info about the diferent systems and locations in the ISS. Oculus is surprising me every week.

I had a lot of fun performing the spacewalk and searching for the airlock... took me about 15min to find it, good that I had enough oxygen... :D
You should add smooth turning, it's better than 30 degrees turn for people that don't  get sick in VR.
Thank you!

This would be a great game if the controls were more polished.  Also, the docking dialogue is very harsh on the player, and I have failed so many times that it made me ragequit.  I play Elite freaking Dangerous and its easier to control than this.

Took a few minutes to get accustomed to moving around, but then was able to explore a space I'll never get to see in real life. It would be a great NASA training tool if they took the time to simulate some more functions of the station.

EVA is awesome.
Need Supersampling option and please make this big rig turn around the earth with night and day transition. Some of us have 1080Ti GPU !
Is it possible to add Breath sound when in the space suit.
Angle turning is a mess, make it smooth.

The experience is just out of this world. It is very responsive and realistic. However, I'm not sure if it was meant to be a demo but It could include more scenarios or challenges. This is an amazing experience.
If you love space, this is for you. I did a live stream of this AND the Devs joined the stream (thank you so much devs) Search 'GametechUK' on youtube to see the video.

Couldn't you put out a version without the need for the touch controllers? Without the interaction? After all the rubbish in the library,  finally something decent comes along, but I don't have the controllers.

review_title: One of the better space sims...
one_reviews_text: As realistic as it is, I think they should raise the comfort rating to Intense.  I almost threw up after 10 minutes...
I would really recomend it how the game works is awsome and the graphics are really good
ALL of the audio should play on the headphones. And the "mission directives" should never play over the video I'm listening to as that should get priority. The "mission" can wait.
If there was an option to get rid of that 30 degree turn in favour of a smooth turn then it would be 5 stars. Meh 5 stars anyway but hey smooth turn option please!
Thank you Oculus and devs, fantastic job.  Even if it was just floating around doing nothing it would be great, but you get to do stuff and interact.  Can't recommend it enough.

Very recommended for anyone into space related stuff. Only downside is it makes me a bit nauseous, but as it is a zero-g sim it is to be expected, and it isn't too bad.

Great app.
Just played for 2 minutes. Never felt so unbalanced on my own two feet in my lifetime.  Literally had me almost falling over.

Great to float around and investigate what the ISS look like both inward and outside.
Use the canadair? arm and other missions.
And it's free.             So just download.

Very polished experience, I love it. Beautiful graphics, good locomotion options and very informative about what's going on the ISS.
Highly recommended to try it out.
I played this game for about 5-10 minutes and now I feel like i'm going to puke
This is amazing, there is so much educational value to this experience and short of stowing away on a Falcon rocket this is the closest I'll get to space.
This is a great example of how VR can be used to advance science and technology. Very thankful for this!
A very good model (from NASA and ESA) of the ISS and you get to dock a module with the Canadarm and EVA!
I have tried numerous times since downlading this and the bloody thing won't install. One star for this.
amazing experience, even better than any videogame. That's the way VR should go to catch new audience.
Very intriguing, indeed!
...you can even feel the space adaptation syndrome ;-)

There is only one word which can describe it: AWESOME!
And it's for free, thank you very much!
This is the real space station. Experience that you can not get somewhere else
This'll be the closest thing I'll ever get to being on the space station myself.
motion sikness like hell.

review_title: Oculus nammmmber 1 and 5 Star for you
one_reviews_text: your the best of best oculus
Great content. Seriously, thank you for creating such a great experience!
Can't Believe This is Free.
Very interesting..
The demonstration is not translated into Spanish. I do not understand the things they say.

review_title: All the one stars are RE Motion Sickness
one_reviews_text:
If you get MS while playing this, that doesn't reflect on the quality of the game. Ridiculous to give it a one-star because you have personal issues. 

Agreed on smooth turn, day/night cycle and 3D earth; other than that a great simulation of something most will never experience.

review_title: Best VR experience I've ever played!
one_reviews_text: It's always been my dream to see space or the ISS with my own eyes, and this is probably the closest I'll ever get! I recommend to any fan of space! It's amazing!
Works so good on the vive, TY
Very interesting..
The demonstration is not translated into Spanish. I do not understand the things they say.

review_title: All the one stars are RE Motion Sickness
one_reviews_text:
If you get MS while playing this, that doesn't reflect on the quality of the game. Ridiculous to give it a one-star because you have personal issues. 

Agreed on smooth turn, day/night cycle and 3D earth; other than that a great simulation of something most will never experience.

review_title: Best VR experience I've ever played!
one_reviews_text: It's always been my dream to see space or the ISS with my own eyes, and this is probably the closest I'll ever get! I recommend to any fan of space! It's amazing!
Works so good on the vive, TY
